Rule.Name: sUnsupportVideoDriver

Rule.Text: Hardware acceleration is disabled in Office programs because your video configuration is not compatible with Office 2013. Please update your video driver as your vendor may have an updated version that is compatible with Office 2013.

Rule.Name: sDisableHardwareAcceleration
Rule.Title: Hardware acceleration is disabled
Rule.Text: You have hardware acceleration disabled. If you have been having video-related problems in Office programs, you should check for an updated video driver. If the driver upgrade fixes the problems, it is recommended you re-enable hardware acceleration.

Rule.Name: sSlowConnection

Rule.Text: Your current Windows theme is using one of the default high-contrast settings. In itself, this is not a problem. However, some high-contrast settings cause problems seeing shapes, drawings, menu items, or other objects in Office programs.

Rule.Text: If either RoomFinderShow=0 or the UMOutlookAddin add-in is not loaded, the Room Finder will not appear in a meeting invite. On your machine, RoomFinderShow = {0} in the registry, and the UmOutlookAddin LoadBehavior={1} (anything other than LoadBehavior=3 means it is not loaded on launch).

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerx64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion>13 and ((substring($.,1,2)='10' and number(substring($.,4,1))<1) or substring($.,1,1)!='1') and $sOutlookBitness='x64'

Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Outlook to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Disabled add-in was re-enabled by user
Rule.Text: At least one add-in that was disabled by Outlook was re-enabled by the user. Please see the Tree Report for the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user.

Rule.Name: sEmptyRestrictedAddinList
Rule.Title: No add-ins are loaded in Outlook due to group policy settings.
Rule.Text: Under the Policies hive, RestrictToList=1 but there are no add-ins listed under the AddinList key. Therefore, no add-ins are being loaded by Outlook. Please make sure this is a desired configuration.

Rule.Name: sDisableAddinLogging
Rule.Title: Add-in logging is not enabled
Rule.Text: Performance logging of add-ins is not enabled. This configuration will limit your ability to troubleshoot problems with add-ins.

Rule.Name: sBadDpofeedb
Rule.Title: Possible crashing issue due to third party file Dpofeedb.dll
Rule.Text: Outlook may crash when you work with shared calendars if a third-party add-in installs certain versions of Dpofeedb.dll

Rule.Name: sDownloadOAB
Rule.Title: The DownloadOAB registry value is set to zero (0)
Rule.Text: When DownloadOAB=0, Outlook does not automatically download the Offline Address Book (OAB).

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafe
Rule.Title: Office Documents will open only in Protected View
Rule.Text: The MarkInternalAsUnsafe registry value is set to 1. Therefore, Office document attachments from internal senders will open in Protected View.

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafePol
Rule.Title: Office Documents will open only in Protected View
Rule.Text: The MarkInternalAsUnsafe registry value is set to 1 through group policy, and Office document attachments from internal senders will open in Protected View. Please see your administrator if you need to change this policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode is not set
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode0
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 0
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode1
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 1
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode2
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 2
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook 10 Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode3
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 3
Rule.Text: Use Outlook Security Group Policy - Outlook uses security settings from Group Policy.

Rule.Name: CheckAdminSettings
Rule.Title: CheckAdminSettings = {0}
Rule.Text: The CheckAdminSettings registry value is not used by Outlook 2007 and above.

Rule.Name: dlumd32VersionOld
Rule.Query: $nCrashCount>0 and $n2DigitVersion=15 and number($dlumd32Version)!=0 and substring($dlumd32Version,2,1)='.' and substring($dlumd32Version,4,1)='.' and number(substring($dlumd32Version,1,1))<9 and number(substring($dlumd32Version,3,1))<7
Rule.Title: Office programs may be crashing due to an outdated DisplayLink driver
Rule.Text: At least one Office 2013 program has crashed in the past 7 days and the DisplayLink user mode driver version on your machine has been known to cause Office programs to crash. Please install the 7.1 M1 update (or later version) for the DisplayLink driver.

Rule.Name: sCoexistSimpleMapi
Rule.Title: Error detected when trying to send email
Rule.Text: An error in the Microsoft Office Alerts log indicates you were previously unable to send a document or file from another application. In this scenario, Outlook 2013 must be running if you also have an earlier version of Outlook installed.

Rule.Name: sCouldNotReadCalendarNonPolicy
Rule.Title: "Could not read the calendar" error condition detected.
Rule.Text: The conditions for the error "Could not read the calendar. The connection to Microsoft Exchange is unavailable." have been detected.

Rule.Name: sEnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes
Rule.Title: EnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes=1
Rule.Text: If you have a shared Exchange mailbox in your profile, you may see performance issues as the folders in this shared mailbox are being indexed. More information: http://blogs.technet.com/mikelag/archive/2009/05/04/windows-desktop-search-and-the-implications-on-wan-performance.aspx

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingOutlook
Rule.Title: Indexing has been disabled using a policy setting in the registry
Rule.Text: Indexing for Windows Desktop Search has been disabled in the registry. Consequently, searching for items in Outlook will take longer.

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders
Rule.Title: PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders=0 in the registry
Rule.Text: The PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders value is set to 0 in the registry. This configuration can cause performance issues with an Online mode profile.

Rule.Name: sWSearchDesktopInteract
Rule.Title: Windows Search Service has "Allow service to interact with Desktop" enabled
Rule.Text: If the Windows Search Service has the "Allow service to interact with Desktop" setting enabled, you may not see any search results in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sMissingMAPIProtocolHandler
Rule.Title: Outlook search may not be functioning properly because Mapiph.dll is missing.
Rule.Text: Your Outlook search results may be incomplete because the file Mapiph.dll is missing from your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sESM
Rule.Title: Exchange System Manager is installed
Rule.Text: No results are returned when you search for e-mail items using Instant Search.

Rule.Name: sOffice2010SP1NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Your Office 2010 installation is out of support.
Rule.Text: Your Office 2010 installation is out of support because Service Pack 1 (SP1) is not installed. Support for pre-SP1 installations ended on July 10, 2012. More information: http://support.microsoft.com/lifecycle/?p1=13615

Rule.Name: sOffice2007SP3NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Service Pack 3 for Microsoft Office 2007 is not installed
Rule.Text: Service Pack 2 for Microsoft Office 2007 is out of support on January 8th, 2013. Please see the support lifecycle site for more information: http://support.microsoft.com/lifecycle/?p1=8753

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags
Rule.Title: Application Compatibility
Rule.Text: Application Compatibility has been set for Outlook. Value={0}

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPath
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPathWow
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBITSInfo
Rule.Query: not($sEnableBITSMaxBandwidth='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOnSchedule='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOffSchedule='not set') or not($sUseSystemMaximum='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidFrom='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidTo='not set')
Rule.Title: BITS Policy Settings

Rule.Name: sBITSServiceDisabled
Rule.Title: BITS service is either stopped or disabled
Rule.Text: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is either stopped or disabled and your Offline Address Book may be out of date.

Rule.Name: sCDOInstalled
Rule.Title: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is installed
Rule.Text: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is not supported on a client with Outlook 2010 installed.

Rule.Name: sRSACertLengthRequireLT1024
Rule.Title: RSA certificate length requirement not set to default value (1024)
Rule.Text: Registry data was found on the client that modifies the default RSA certificate length requirement. Microsoft does not recommend customers use certificates less than 1024 bits long. The registry data should only be used as a temporary workaround.

Rule.Name: sBadDCOMValues
Rule.Title: Machine configuration settings may prevent opening Office document attachments
Rule.Text: The DCOM settings on this computer may cause you to receive errors when you open Office documents from email attachments. If you are unable to open email attachments, click the FixIt link below to reconfigure your machine settings.

Rule.Name: sDefaultMailClient
Rule.Title: No e-mail messages are sent from Outlook when completing a mail merge using the HTML e-mail format
Rule.Text: When you perform a mail merge from Microsoft Word, no e-mail messages are sent from Microsoft Outlook when you use the HTML e-mail message format for your mail merge.

Rule.Name: sBrokenHtmRegistration
Rule.Title: Hyperlinks are not working in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you click a hyperlink in Microsoft Outlook, you receive one of the following error messages, depending on your Outlook version:
This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator.
Your organization's policies are preventing us from completing this action for you. For more info, please contact your help desk.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIcon14
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface due to registry settings for this feature.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegration14
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled by registry settings.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIcon14Pol
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface due to group policy settings for this feature.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegration14Pol
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled by group policy.

Rule.Name: sWWLIBVersion
Rule.Title: WWLIB version = {0}
Rule.Text: This version of wwlib.dll can cause Outlook to crash when doing a mail merge if the message contains a Helvetica Type 1 font. If you experience this problem please install at least December 2010 Cumulative Update for Word 2010.

Rule.Name: sMAPI32Version
Rule.Title: Mail Merge doesn't work
Rule.Text: Mail merge in Microsoft Word does not work on a computer that is running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.

Rule.Name: sBadMsoutlolb
Rule.Title: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly
Rule.Text: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly in the Windows Registry. In this situation, you may encounter problems performing a Mail Merge operation from Microsoft Word.

Rule.Name: sFileExtensionsWrongVersion
Rule.Query: $fSxS and ( ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID='not set' and $.!='Outlook.File.msg.15') or ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='not set' and $fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='Outlook.File.msg.15') )
Rule.Title: File extensions for Outlook are not associated with the latest installed Outlook version
Rule.Text: File extensions (like .msg) for Outlook are not associated with Outlook 2013. Therefore, if you double-click a .msg file it may open in an earlier version of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName15
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sOldOLCWow
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook

Rule.Name: sOldOLC32
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sOldOLC64

Rule.Name: Wd2007NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2007 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2007 and Word 2007 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs.

Rule.Name: Wd2010NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2010 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2010 and Word 2010 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs.

Rule.Name: Wd2013NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2013 is not installed

Rule.Name: sZeroByteDefProfXML
Rule.Title: Zero byte profile.xml
Rule.Text: %DEFPROF%.xml is zero bytes. This can prevent Outlook from starting. To solve this problem, start Outlook with the /resetnavpane switch or install the June 2010 Cumulative Update for Outlook 2007.

Rule.Name: sTooManyShortcutsDefProf
Rule.Title: Large number of shortcuts detected: {0}
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding if you have 200 or more shortcuts in the Navigation Pane.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKey
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sMissingAppData
Rule.Title: AppData registry value is missing
Rule.Text: The AppData registry value is missing in HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell Folders. This prevents the user to connect or create a new profile.

Rule.Name: sUserShellFoldersCacheNotDefault
Rule.Query: (number(substring($WindowsVersion,1,1))>5 and $UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\appdata\local\microsoft\windows\temporary internet files')) or (number(substring($WindowsVersion,1,1))=5 and $UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\local settings\temporary internet files'))
Rule.Title: The path for the Cache value under the \User Shell Folders key is not the default value
Rule.Text: When Outlook opens an email message containing an image, temporary files are written into the path specified by the Cache value in the registry. If this path is not the default setting, Outlook may be unable to render the image.

Rule.Name: sMSILoggingXP
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: sMSILogging
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchange
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile and the ZeroConfigExchange registry value is set to 1.

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchangeP
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1 Policy is set
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile and the ZeroConfigExchange policy is set to 1.
